title: Mobile-Based Mathematics Curriculum Adaptation Strategies for Students with Disabilities: Integrating Computation, Formula, and Graph Utilization with Universal Design for Learning (UDL)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge in the field (mathematics education theory, support strategies for students with disabilities) and practical experience, with foundational computational skills, formula application, graph interpretation, and understanding of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles
context.additional_context: Development and application practice of accessibility-adjusted curriculum tools (accessibility calculators, equation converters, interactive graph tools) for different disabilities in smart device-centered learning environments. Emphasizes UDL (Universal Design for Learning) application for math concepts (equations, statistics, geometry). Includes multimodal representation (text/audio/tactile) and interactive learning activity design.

learning_goals: Learners develop equation-solving, statistical analysis, and geometric graph interpretation skills using accessibility tools (accessible calculators, formula converters, interactive graph tools) tailored to disability types in mobile environments

Learners apply Universal Design for Learning (UDL) strategies to adapt math curricula (linear/nonlinear equations, probability distributions, polygon graphs) to various disability types (visual/hearing/learning impairments)

Learners implement and evaluate curriculum adaptation strategies (accessibility assessment, error pattern analysis, multi-feedback systems) with â‰¥80% accuracy through formative assessments, proposing evidence-based improvements

resources: Database of Adaptation Cases by Disability Type
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
